segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: At a broad table, here in the banquet hall of the Villa Aurora, the Halovar estate. Teor, you are seated on a exquisite, velvet-lined and cushioned seat as a small, white velvet sack of coins lands with a thunk in front of you. The woman speaking to you says, "And of course, for any accoutrement needed for your service as a guardian errant of the Lord Wicander Halovar. The Mercanaud Couturier will be happy to fit you and your gear to our station. We attempt to make clear that violence is always a regrettable, tragic, and final resort; that the weaponry, armor, and tabardry of our various vassals and men-at-arms bear the symbol of the Candescent Creed, but we would shudder to think of you going out of your own pocket for that."
segments.summary: Teor receives payment and instructions about getting fitted for gear at the Mercanaud Couturier as part of his service to Lord Wicander Halovar
segments.location: Villa Aurora, Halovar estate banquet hall

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: Oh, that is most understood. I think, if I might suggest an alternative, perhaps for an extra level of security, perhaps I could stay as I am, plainclothes, not draw attention to anything that needs to be done on behalf of the Candescent Creed. A more covert security force.
segments.summary: Teor suggests staying in plainclothes for covert security work
segments.location: Villa Aurora, Halovar estate banquet hall

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Give me a persuasion check.

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: Five.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: She goes, "A splendid suggestion. It is such an exciting proposition to imagine, that by wearing the symbol of the Candescent Creed, you may attempt to be covert in proudly wearing the symbol of the order."

segments.location: Villa Aurora, Halovar estate banquet hall

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: Ah, I see.

segments.location: Villa Aurora, Halovar estate banquet hall

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Close behind you, you hear (dog growling, barking) as the door flies open and on these sets of silvery white chains, this massive knight walks in, heavily-armored, gray-bearded, human knight. He's got gleaming luminous tattoos all around his neck that curl up around over his eyes. He walks in and goes, "Ah, you're the (sniffs) former Bannersman, yes?"

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)

segments.speaker: Sir Filoneus Halovar (Brennan)
segments.content: My name? I am Sir Filoneus Halovar. These are my dogs, Wrath and Judgment. I can't tell which one is which, but then again, when it comes to wrath and judgment, (thump), who can?!
segments.summary: Sir Filoneus introduces himself and his dogs Wrath and Judgment
segments.location: Villa Aurora, Halovar estate banquet hall

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: One of them snarls and it has a dull glow from the back of the dog's throat. You hear a faint humming from its vocal cords, almost like it can't stop whining. This whining is beautiful, ethereal, almost angelic.

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)

segments.speaker: Sir Filoneus Halovar (Brennan)

But you see a servant opens the door leading to exit the estate. "We shall be in touch when the Lord Wicander calls for you."

segments.content: You see that as you exit to the street, move over, nearby, not far away from the Villa Aurora at the Palazzo Davinos, we see walking out, under the early afternoon sun, Julien Davinos. Where are you headed to on this morning?

segments.speaker: Sir Julien Davinos (Matt)
segments.content: I'm looking for this Occtis figure. I recall we had an encounter when he was very young many years ago and I thought I caught a keen-- There's a look about the family that's very specific, but was in the company of Thaisha, last I saw.

segments.speaker: Sir Julien Davinos (Matt)
segments.content: So I would likely be heading towards, probably to house domain to see if I can find where she might be, and then through her, find out where this boy might be.

segments.content: Teor, you remember the events of the previous day, but you've had business to attend to with Loza's departure and everything else that's been occurring. Where do you think you would head in this moment?

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: I actually think I would head to this place they've sent me to, at least to know what the next step would be, but I would also be trying to keep an eye out for anyone from the funeral that we've seen just in case our paths might cross.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Walking through the Ogrimock Marketplace, towering shelves of ripe fruit, towering shelves of ripe fruit, spices, produce. You see there's a hanging fish market with fish, blocks of ice that they've been delivered on, raw foodstuffs, and you see fine tapestry, silk, and armories like you wouldn't believe. The Ogrimok Marketplace has some of the finest weapons dealers and armorers in all the world. This is the home of the Lloy family where they built, they smithed the blades made to kill a god, and so you smell steel and forgecraft all around you. You also see parchment nailed with daggers to posts all throughout. By order of the Chamber of the Lords-Advisory, all arcane magic is forbidden by law within the confines of the marketplace. On that high perception, as you keep your head on a swivel, the strange, in a lively market that's still muted-feeling, Julien and Teor catch each other's eye as you move to go to the couturier and you move to the bridge across the River Vrosh to The Rookery.

segments.speaker: Sir Julien Davinos (Matthew Mercer)
segments.content: Our next sponsor is PlayStation and their brand new game, 'Ghost of Yōtei.' Love, grief, and revenge collide in 'Ghost of Yōtei,' a new PlayStation 5 experience set in 1600's Japan. You'll play as Atsu, a mercenary on a quest to avenge her family, traveling across snow-capped ridges and forgotten shrines to confront those who wronged her. Along the way, you'll strike with brutal precision using weapons like the ōdachi and the kusarigama, while forging bonds that endure far beyond battle. We're especially excited because a friend of the show, Erika Ishii, voices Atsu, joining Critical Role's castmates Ashley Johnson and Laura Bailey as unforgettable PlayStation characters. Atsu's journey across Ezo is a breathtaking and emotional story of vengeance, healing, and redemption. Then stick around if you want to see how beautiful and brutal this game is as the trailer is coming up later during the break. Now 'Ghost of Yōtei' is available now on PlayStation 5. Thank you, PlayStation, for sponsoring this episode, Rated M for Mature. Hmm. Laura, you're up.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: We return, deep underground in front of the opening of the Prismatic Retort, whereupon a towering celestial with gnashing teeth strains and fights against massive chains, each link more than an arm's width around. each link more than an arm's width around. Enormous muscles ripple across this monstrous body. Multiple skeletal fingers, more like a bat's wings than a bird's, stretch out and grind and crack against more chains, enclosures. You see, (shrieks) the face ravaged by pain and misery (snarls) as gleaming saliva or perhaps blood, spills down from his mouth. Your grandmother, Yanessa, turns and says, 'It's something that's almost too hard to be believed. Wicky, my little ducky, I love you and I understand that this is unusual.'
segments.summary: The group returns to see the chained celestial in the Prismatic Retort. Yanessa speaks to Wicander about the unusual situation.

segments.speaker: Wicander (Sam)
segments.content: I take a step back, gripping my cane, and I think just looking around at the craziness of this image, of this gigantic monster thrashing about, and then also juxtaposed with everybody feeling like it's commonplace or looking like they've seen this a hundred times before, and I guess I'm staring at different faces to try to register who is surprised by this, if anyone.
segments.summary: Wicander steps back in shock and looks around to see if anyone else is surprised by the chained celestial.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: She says, 'Ah-- I.' Your father does not look surprised at all. Nearby, you see your elder sister emerges. Nearby, you see your elder sister emerges. This is the Lady Zebani Halovar, and trailing behind her is your sister, Tyranny; Cruelty. Zebani steps forward, your older sister. 'Glad you're finally in the fold, Wick.'
segments.summary: Godard shows no surprise. Zebani Halovar and Tyranny appear, with Zebani welcoming Wicander to the family secret.

segments.speaker: Wicander (Sam)
segments.content: I look to Tyranny to find any sort of support in anyone's glance, and I'll nod to my sister and say: Oh, yes, I've been, I suppose, educated as to-- I'm sorry, the Filament is-- is that creature's blood?
segments.summary: Wicander looks to Tyranny for support and asks if the Filament is the creature's blood.

segments.speaker: Yanessa (Brennan)
segments.content: No, no, no, Wicky.
segments.summary: Yanessa corrects Wicander about the nature of the Filament.

segments.speaker: Wicander (Sam)
segments.content: Oh.
segments.summary: Wicander responds with surprise.

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar (Sam Riegel)
segments.content: back at the sight of the thrashing monster. Yes, I suppose it is beautiful in its way, and forgive me for just taking a moment to take it all in, but of course you had your reasons, and of course, they were right. I suppose I'll just need a moment to process it all, that's all--

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "Of course."

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar (Sam Riegel)
segments.content: -- and to find out what I'm meant to do. What am I meant to do?

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "Everything!"

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar (Sam Riegel)
segments.content: Am I still the Scion of the family? Am I still--

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Zebani says "It's a great question." You see that Yanessa turns to her and says, "Zebani! That's enough out of you. Your sister, everyone has their gifts." "Your sister's very skilled." "She's not set up to be the face of much of anything, is she?"

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar (Sam Riegel)
segments.content: She's lovely!

segments.speaker: Tyranny (Whitney Moore)
segments.content: (scoffs)

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar (Sam Riegel)
segments.content: She's lovely.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "We need a little more honesty around here."

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar (Sam Riegel)
segments.content: I think I could carry the family's name very well.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "I think you can, too, but the reason I had to tell you is this whole thing with Thjazi Fang and you pushing this thing with Hal, it was just-- The things that we say in the Creed, it's good rules. You write down these rules because you know that people you don't know are going to read them, and you want there to be something that makes the ground under your feet steady. You need some reliability, right? It's sort of like-- think about this, right? There's a lake with fish in it, and it's good fish, but it's not yours, it's the king's, and you want to poach those fish, yeah? But if everybody does it, it'd be all out of fish because that's why the rule's there, so the ideal situation is only you poach the fish so you get your fish, but nobody else does because they believe in the rule that you shouldn't do that. Does that make sense?"

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar (Sam Riegel)
segments.content: I mean, couldn't you just share enough fish with everybody?

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "Wick, I need you to listen to me!"

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar (Sam Riegel)
segments.content: Yes, it's not about the fish, is it?

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "Thjazi Fang had to die for reasons that were political, for reasons that are setting ourselves up to stay close to people that we don't know what they're doing, so I've got you in my ear like a gnat talking about spreading the faith, and listen, we do need to spread the faith to Dol-Makjar, for sure, but the zeal was coming from something in your heart that you thought we needed to listen to these-- You're quoting the Creed to me all the time, so--"

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar (Sam Riegel)
segments.content: It's beautiful. I mean, the--

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "Just don't do it anymore. The Creed is--"

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar (Sam Riegel)
segments.content: All right.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "-- exactly what we need it to be."

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar (Sam Riegel)

segments.content: "Exactly!"

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar (Sam Riegel)

segments.content: "Exactly, and a smith looking at a hammer and saying, 'Well, I'm going to let the hammer boss me around.' That's demented."

segments.content: Yes, of course. I've been looking at it the wrong way, I suppose.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "I know. I hate your mother. She--"

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar (Sam Riegel)
segments.content: Oh.

segments.content: Right. Right. Yes. Yes, we are fixing it now, and I think I understand and I'm up to the task. Yes. Just, sorry. Yes, Grandmother. You see she looks at you and says, "I know you had this romance thing with the one who got away, but this marriage to the D'Antonio needs to happen."

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar (Sam Riegel)
segments.content: Right, yes. While all cards are on the table, so to speak, why, again, must I marry this woman? I mean, she seems lovely on paper, but I don't know her at all.

segments.content: "So her father is very old in age, and I believe their son is younger and is more or less abdicated from his position there. They sit on a plot of land with a series of vineyards that produce a magical, an alchemical element within the fruit of that vineyard that will allow the Filament that we can dilute it pretty considerably."

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar (Sam Riegel)

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: At the very bottom of the cascading falls of Dol-Makjar where the River Vrosh lets out into Lake Nahami, as the city and its tall, spiraling towers begins to fade into the nearby woods, and the highway taking off to neighboring towns, deeper into the land of Kahad, we see here at the base, the tall spires of Dol-Makjar, this city that was the shield of Kahad during long centuries that stood as the shields to the orcish homeland against the mountain dwarves to their east, to the humans to their north, at a time ruled by the Shapers. Now it beholds a metropolis, a place where all peoples united in revolution and rebellion against the gods, can sing and trade, dance and perform magic. And when we speak of perform, place of performance, at the very base of that city, surrounded by the woods at the very edge, we see an ancient place with a brand new wooden sign leaning against a massive stone entranceway, leaning against a massive stone entranceway, and we see some boots approaching that sign. And Liam, what does it say on that sign that now waits with so much potential there by the wall?
segments.summary: Scene opens at the bottom of Dol-Makjar with description of the ancient performance venue

segments.speaker: Halandil Fang (Liam)
segments.content: Oh, with lumber still off to the side in a pile, the sign reads, "The Hallowed Round." A pun.
segments.summary: Halandil describes the theater's new sign

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Before you, you see an ancient dithyramb, an amphitheater. This place can fit thousands, it is truly enormous, and at its center there is a stage, and that stage, ancient stone, you see there's some ruins and collapsing around, you see various members of your theater troupe, that as you approach with Thaisha and Shadia, call out, "Hey, Hal!" As hammer (pounding), wood putting stuff up. You see some tarps covering some things outside. And I'd like you to describe, if you can, any of the environs, and also the stage, in particular for us.
segments.summary: Brennan describes the massive ancient amphitheater being renovated

segments.speaker: Halandil Fang (Liam)
segments.content: It's coming along, isn't it? It is a massive place and in Thaisha and my youth, it was much wilder here. The place has been in disuse for decades. For centuries before the fall of the Shapers, this was a place where our god, our Shaper, would sometimes appear in the heavens above the city to witness his people exalting in ecstatic fervent ritual unto our keeper. And from the vantage point that we're at, you can actually see for miles, the city is surrounded by evergreen forest, and from this vantage point, and we're at the top looking down to the bottom of this amphitheater, and at the center of the amphitheater is a massive, gnarled, twisted cedar tree that is extreme-looking, but beautiful in this rugged landscape, and it's hard not to come here and not imagine this massive being lording over our city, which was the purpose of this place. But again, long out of use, forbidden for decades, and only now in the last handful of years has that begun to change, although you have heard me talking about this for many, many years. And there it is. Still more work to do. We're getting close. I know what we're going to start with. We just have to get all our magpies in a row and it's almost time.
segments.summary: Halandil describes the ancient amphitheater's history and its massive cedar tree centerpiece

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: This is incredible. And Thaisha is wrestling-- We've talked about it and went back and forth in letters and correspondence. It's such a fraught place that your desire to reclaim it, well-intended though it is, I think there's just that little bit of her that can't quite get comfortable standing here. You see that standing here, she had no struggles walking up, but she is going to reach towards what looks like a little dagger in her belt. It's all metal with a little horse head at the top and she'll wrap her hands around it and cast her Druidcraft into it and turn it into a horse-headed cane to walk down to view more of this with. There is something about this place that makes her want to sit in her power as a druid, as we move through a space that was so compelled and held by the god we destroyed.
segments.summary: Thaisha feels uncomfortable in this space tied to their destroyed god, transforms her dagger into a cane

segments.speaker: Halandil Fang (Liam)
segments.content: And Hal is just admiring his best friend in the world, striding down this hill into the center of this ancient place. And I think by the time they get to the bottom and they're on the edge of the performance area, you can see low wooden buildings that are-- you've never seen before off to the sides, and you can see performers and construction workers moving in and out. You can tell that they're going to be used as backstage and storage, and the tree is now high above us down at this vantage point. And as we turn to look back up from where we came, I say:
segments.summary: Halandil describes new construction as they descend into the amphitheater

segments.speaker: Halandil Fang (Liam)
segments.content: Well, once we came here to celebrate a god, now we come to celebrate each other.
segments.summary: Halandil reflects on the venue's transformation from religious to secular purpose

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: Halandil, I should never have doubted. This is amazing.
segments.summary: Thaisha expresses admiration for Halandil's project

segments.speaker: Halandil Fang (Liam)
segments.content: Well, don't be too hasty because government's falling apart. I can't nail down what we're allowed to do. We've got centuries of tradition and smoke and mirrors to do everything we do, and one day we're allowed to do one thing and then three days later it sounds like it is off the table again and I'm not really sure whether to shit or go blind.
segments.summary: Halandil expresses frustration with unstable government regulations

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: I know it doesn't always go well when I offer this, but you know my family has resources that you can lean into whenever you want if you need things to go a little more smoothly.
segments.summary: Thaisha offers her family's resources to help with the project

segments.speaker: Halandil Fang (Liam)
segments.content: I've gone over it with Olgud, I think we're in the black.
segments.summary: Halandil mentions discussing finances with Olgud

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: Okay, okay.
segments.summary: Thaisha acknowledges Halandil's financial situation

segments.speaker: Halandil Fang (Liam)
segments.content: Don't worry.
segments.summary: Halandil reassures Thaisha

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: Thank you for showing me this. I'm going to lean over to Shadia and be like: Okay, what are those buildings?
segments.summary: Thaisha thanks Halandil and asks Shadia about the new buildings

segments.speaker: Shadia (DM)
segments.content: So, these are going to be-- You know, this place was a place where we had to propitiate the god of war that kept us captive and, you know.
segments.summary: Shadia begins explaining the buildings while referencing the venue's dark history

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: Yeah.
segments.summary: Thaisha acknowledges the historical context

segments.speaker: Shadia (DM)
segments.content: But, that's going to be a concession stand and we're going to have-- We're going to have fruit leather and we're going to have-- Oh, and we're going to have the sweet, that gourd, you know that squash bread, we're going to have that.
segments.summary: Shadia enthusiastically describes concession stand plans

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: Oh.
segments.summary: Thaisha reacts to the food descriptions

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "Also, if you look at this--" and you see she starts to show you these hooks what was a broad amphitheater is being separated into boxes they're putting up, so there's cool woodwork going on where the benches are still stone, but you're looking at why they're being partitioned off and you see these partitions because there are, Shadia starts to explain, "Because it's outdoors, but it's raining a lot in Dol-Makjar and you know, people used to just get wet, but you get sick, so you can pull the covers up." She does this big fabric and you see there's a waxed beautiful, and they're all multicolored and you see that some of them are harlequin pattern. Some of them are tasseled that come up and make this little rain roof. She says, "And--" You see that she takes out, she throws a crate and you see 30 little silvery filigreed, they're made of tin or something kind of cheap, but they look beautiful. Where she stands, the earth is improved as it remembers itself. But our home is beautiful and this gift isn't for here. So it's with a little wistful sigh that she goes back and nods about the umbrellas and asks a thousand more follow-up questions.

"I know how special you are, and you can see the person I'm becoming. I feel like I can't see her at all. I sometimes get mad at myself because I feel like I don't want you to see the person, I want you to see the becoming. I just-- I don't know, Uncle Thjazi's dead, and every time you go, I know that-- I'm really scared about Alogar."

segments.content: Yeah, I am too. But we were shaped by a god that told us not to fear and keep moving forward. It's not fair to carry that forward. But there is subtle wisdom in it. You can't live your life afraid. And Alogar is his mother's son and made a choice to protect this world with his blade. and made a choice to protect this world with his blade. Just as you and your father are protecting this world by protecting and creating the stories and songs of it. You make the joy that all of the wandering and all of the fighting and fear are worth. And I know that's not-- I know that's not a comfort, not really. But it's what I tell myself at night when I miss you most.

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)

If Casimir headed north towards Timmony, that's the direction you've just come from.

(giggles) Sort of step-touching around, but watching and what you think you're seeing is a fool and maybe a part of him is. And I haven't had much time with you, even though we were in the same city working for the same person, in a way, but I didn't-- But if you need to leave tonight, then I can help.

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: Azune, we're going to make them all pay, yeah?

segments.content: I want to go.

segments.content: You have more pull in this city than any of us combined. Well, except for maybe that shit.

And as I look over, I see Hal, who I realize maybe a part of me subconsciously in the last 24 hours I've been avoiding and I see you with the scimitar, a visage of a warrior that was never meant to be and I turn back to you, Thimble, and I say: Make them pay for me, too.

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: For Thjazi.

segments.speaker: LUIS
segments.content: Yeah.

So you're going to go up north, yeah? And all the mirth and good humor that's been in him in this evening fades away and he becomes deadly serious. City folk. All your drama, all your interpersonal workings. Have any of you been in the wild, lately? Because let me tell you something. It's not what you think. I just came from Timmony naught but three nights ago and you had better prepare yourselves.

segments.content: Costume cloaks are easy enough to acquire here in the home of a veteran actor and thespian. Your final moments are shared here in Hal's home. He wears Thjazi's sword on his back. Your final moments with Thjazi, who, if you ever return to Dol-Makjar, will be in his final resting place. Are there any final words shared here before the night welcomes you?

segments.speaker: Halandil Fang (Liam O'Brien)
segments.content: As they're about to leave, I catch Thimble by the door and low, with reverberation to his voice, he says: Find him for our brother. And take a Bardic Inspiration with you as you leave.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: I'm going to say with Thjazi's sword on your back at the threshold of your house, the iron nail of the Lloy family overhead. You bid farewell.

segments.speaker: Halandil Fang (Liam O'Brien)
segments.content: Yeah.

segments.content: You look warm.

segments.content: (laughs)

segments.content: I think the silence says more than any words could.

segments.content: At the top of the city, bidding farewell to Thjazi, Kattigan, the stables of The Grey Tower stand beside an open balcony high above the waterfall and you look and see a falcon's nest nearby. You draw five horses out here at the Falcon's Rest.

The names here in this monument seem almost hidden under shadow as though in remembering them, Dol-Makjar still had to hide some shame that they did not lend their full support when the falcon's cry rang out across these lands.

segments.content: There's one thing I would like to do. As they start getting ready to leave, I will start to recite the names of those that fought alongside us in the Falconers' Rebellion that did not make it through, and I will keep that going as they ride off. and I will keep that going as they ride off.

segments.content: Five brought together head north. A brother in danger, a life turned into chaos, and maybe if you're lucky, vengeance. We'll see you five at the Soldiers' table. Farewell.

segments.content: Farewell, and for the rest of you, I'll say farewell as well, though we will be seeing you next week. I need Matt, Alex, and Ashley back here.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Thaisha. You hear the song. It's powerful, beautiful, but it's a word of warning. Something magical is happening and you look across the bridge as you are crossing it. You can feel the jasmine heralding your approach. You look across at what can only be described as one dedicated to the memory of a Shaper that took the world of nature for her own and bent it to her will, and you look across, and in this moment, know that doom will befall your world if you cannot find her spirit in your own and she yours.

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: There is a moment of eye contact and just unbidden, a howl rips from her and it is long and mourning, and then she returns her gaze to you and she is stopped, and gets low. It's something between a pounce, but it's not submission. It is what is about to happen next and she waits and watches you.

segments.speaker: Vaelus (Ashley)
segments.content: I think hearing that, Vaelus hasn't had this feeling in a long time, almost as if her heart has-- it's beating again for the first time, and hearing that mourning howl, something gets caught in her throat. An emotion, something. I will start briskly walking towards the wolf.

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: I approach at the same speed.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: The wolf vanishes. You are separated by so much distance, but in this starlight here, it's an unusually clear night for Dol-Makjar. Connecting over this vast distance, the wolf continues into the city and you walk forward seeing multiple small gates in the walls of the Palazzo manned by guards of the Davinos. By whatever measure necessary, you know that a door must be left open for that wolf, as certain as you have ever been about the magic workings of this world.

segments.speaker: Vaelus (Ashley)
segments.content: I will cast Command.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: You walk up and you see a guard looks over and says, "My lady."

segments.speaker: Vaelus (Ashley)
segments.content: Open the gate.

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: Ooh!

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: He goes, "Yes." You see that he opens it as the other guard says, "Devin, do you--" And he says, "Yes, my lady." You see is crying without knowing why. Just opens it.

segments.speaker: Sir Julien Davinos (Matthew Mercer)
segments.content: (laughs)

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: What's up? (laughter)

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: You open the gate and stand in the open doorway.

segments.speaker: Vaelus (Ashley)
segments.content: I stand in the open doorway and I put a hand out to sniff.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: We move from there. You wait. You can hear the wolf approaching. It will take time for the wolf to go through the city, but this door will be open when that wolf arrives.

segments.speaker: Vaelus (Ashley)
segments.content: Great.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: We move back into the palazzo. Aranessa arrives up at your room, beautiful little appointed. There's a table in the center of the room. Off to a doorway, there's a little bed chamber. She looks and says, "Occtis, have you done anything that you should not have?"

segments.speaker: Occtis Tachonis (Alexander Ward)
segments.content: To what are you referring? I'm sure I have--

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Your family believes that you were involved with an attempt to rescue my husband, my late husband.

segments.speaker: Occtis Tachonis (Alexander Ward)
segments.content: (scoffs) Oh.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "Why would they believe that?"

segments.speaker: Occtis Tachonis (Alexander Ward)
segments.content: Can I insight check?

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Yeah.

segments.speaker: Occtis Tachonis (Alexander Ward)
segments.content: I know she was at the funeral and I know she knows people that I know.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Mm-hmm.

segments.speaker: Occtis Tachonis (Alexander Ward)
segments.content: I'm terrible at this. Absolutely not, a two.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "Our processional caravan behind us was stopped at the eastern edge of the Dvalmar Pass. Do you know why?"

segments.speaker: Occtis Tachonis (Alexander Ward)
segments.content: Look, I'm just-- I've been out of town for the last six months. I only came back because we heard he was being executed.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "Occtis, the doors to Faerie closed because the realm of death is so choked with souls that cannot move to an afterlife because we killed the gods, that that energy burst into our world and almost struck the heart of Faerie, killing it forever. Your family and my family each have a castle not in this world, and I don't think many common folk know that."

segments.speaker: Occtis Tachonis (Alexander Ward)
segments.content: No.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "My family has a castle in the Golden Orchard halfway between our world and Faerie and it is dying. Your family has a castle in Death."

segments.speaker: Occtis Tachonis (Alexander Ward)
segments.content: It's doing both, honestly. It's getting more powerful and with every death. I know.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "Your family's looking for you."

segments.speaker: Occtis Tachonis (Alexander Ward)
segments.content: Yeah.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "Thjazi was collecting things towards the end. I believe he was collecting-- He asked Thaisha, and by extension you, to collect something."

segments.speaker: Occtis Tachonis (Alexander Ward)
segments.content: Yes.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "What was it?"

segments.speaker: Occtis Tachonis (Alexander Ward)
segments.content: A box.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "Did it have any connection to-- I was not able to be granted audience, either by your family or the Halovar. Do you know anything about what his intentions were with the box?"

segments.speaker: Occtis Tachonis (Alexander Ward)
segments.content: I do not. I only know that we were supposed to bring it back here to him. Obviously, that didn't happen. I believe, to the extent of my knowledge, Thaisha still has the box.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "Occtis, why is there an elven warrior downstairs?"

segments.speaker: Occtis Tachonis (Alexander Ward)
segments.content: That is so complicated. I don't know. Apparently your, your late husband stole something from her and she's here to find it. That is the literal reason why she's here, but the reason why she followed me here, I can't say, she's very confusing. But she's here to protect me?

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "What did he steal?"

segments.speaker: Occtis Tachonis (Alexander Ward)
segments.content: A stone.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: (knocks) "Yes?" She goes and says, "Ah, your bed clothes," and goes to move to the door.

segments.speaker: Occtis Tachonis (Alexander Ward)
segments.content: Oh.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: We move downstairs. General Raimond is down there. (Raimond) "No word from the carriages at the eastern edge of the pass. The Tachonis are moving. Their forces in the city are maybe triple what we imagined they would be."

segments.speaker: Sir Julien Davinos (Matthew Mercer)
segments.content: Oh, so this is fairly grave, then. What is going on, Father?

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "I don't know. I don't know why the Lady Aranessa was not met. I don't know. Do you know anything about a, a stone, a missing stone?"

segments.speaker: Sir Julien Davinos (Matthew Mercer)
segments.content: Julien's head flicks over his left shoulder, almost in the direction of the entryway to the palazzo. Looks at his father. No, I don't.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "I suppose I owe you some thanks for retrieving Occtis. At least you can follow that direction. Some of your courtiers, your consorts, Some of your courtiers, your consorts, I believe are waiting upstairs if you wish to help yourself to some of the Cormoray wine." "if you wish to help yourself to some of the Cormoray wine."

segments.speaker: Sir Julien Davinos (Matthew Mercer)
segments.content: He goes to speak up for a second, his body tensing before deflating a bit. Gives his father one more look and leaves the chamber and heads out to where he last saw Vaelus.

segments.speaker: Ashley Johnson
segments.content: I thought he meant that in a metaphysical, a philosophical way.

segments.speaker: Ashley Johnson
segments.content: I did, too!

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: But no!

segments.speaker: Ashley Johnson
segments.content: I was like: Oh, okay. Oh, oh, he's dead.

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: Shit's bad.
